review: I just hooked mine up yesterday and first off setting this up is very easy.  Power it up, select wireless network, enter password and done.  I've used Netflix, Amazon Prime video and Pandora so far and all are easy to use.  Picture and sound quality is awesome.  Easy of use is worth five stars alone.  If you have a kindle you will be familiar with navigation.  So far I love my Fire TV.  The one improvement I would make would be to include a HDMI cable in the box and maybe a bundle that includes the game controller.  I did scroll through the available games and there are quite a few I am interested in.
author: Gamer "Family Gamer"

review: The Kindle Fire TV is a small package packed with tons and tons of features.  It was easy to set up.  The voice activation is correct 100% of the time.  This is a cable TV killer.  Keep adding channels and features!

review: I love this item.  I have prime because I do a lot of online Christmas and birthday shopping since I live in a very rural area that you basically have one store to shop in unless you want to drive 2 hours.  I would watch the prime instant video's on lunch breaks or my kids would watch them on their kindles but other wise it seemed useless.  Now the whole family can enjoy it and we are finding new series to fall in love with.  I would highly recommend this especially for someone with kids.

review: It runs XBMC really well! Not out of the box, but once its installed via Android Developer Tools. XBMC even plays 1080p video well on this device too. Very happy. Just wish you could add side-loaded apps to the home-screen apps list.Side Note: If you must reboot this (rare), don't unplug and replug-in the power to reboot this. Just hold the [Select] and [Play/Pause] buttons for a few seconds. (Select is the center of the nav-circle.) Rebooted! Done.
